adventure_overview: In this Adventure, the Protect Yourself Rules will give you guidance on keeping yourself safe. You will also identify ways to use electronics responsibly and ways to protect your body when you’re playing or working. When bears feel they are in danger, they may stand on their back legs, standing tall, to let the danger know that they are brave and know how to keep themselves safe. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: With permission from your parent or legal guardian, watch the Protect Yourself Rules video for the Bear rank.

activities.name: Protect Yourself Rules Video Bear
activities.description: Watch the Protect Yourself Rules video with your parent or legal guardian.

requirements.text: Complete the Personal Space Bubble worksheet that is part of the Protect Yourself Rules resources.

activities.name: Personal Bubble
activities.description: Identify people that fall within Intimate, Personal, Social, and Public bubbles.

requirements.text: With your parent or legal guardian, set up a family policy for digital devices.

activities.name: Family Digital Device Policy
activities.description: With parents and legal guardians, set up a family digital device policy.

requirements.text: Identify common personal safety gear for your head, eyes, mouth, hands, and feet.  List how each of these items protect you.  Demonstrate the proper use of personal safety gear for an activity.

activities.name: Kitchen Safety Gear
activities.description: Learn about personal safety in the kitchen.

activities.name: Science Safety Gear
activities.description: Learn about personal safety gear needed for conducting a science experiment.

activities.name: Sport Safety Gear
activities.description: Learn about personal safety gear needed for skating / rollerblading.
